greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = number of distinct positive integers represented in binary which are substrings of binary expansion of n.
comment: a(n) = A078822(n) if n is of the form 2^k - 1. Otherwise, a(n) = A078822(n) - 1.
a(n) = sum (A057427(A213629(n,k): k = 1 .. n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 17 2012
Length of n-th row in triangle A165416. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 17 2015
link: Jeremy Gardiner, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
example: Binary 1 = 1, binary 2 = 10, binary 4 = 100 and binary 9 = 1001 are all substrings of binary 9 = 1001. So a(9) = 4.
mathematica: f[n_] := Length@ Select[ Union[ FromDigits /@ Flatten[ Table[ Partition[ IntegerDigits[n, 2], i, 1], {i, Floor[ Log[2, n] + 1]}], 1]], # > 0 &]; Array[f, 90]
program: (PARI) a(n) = my (v=0, s=0, x=Set()); while (n, my (r=n); while (r, if (r < 100 000, if (bittest(s,r), break, s+=2^r), if (setsearch(x,r), break, x=setunion(x, Set(r)))); v++; r \= 2); n -= 2^(#binary(n)-1)); v \\ _Rémy Sigrist_, Mar 08 2018
return len(set(int(b[i:j]) for i in range(m) for j in range(i+1,m+1))-{0})
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 91)]) # _Michael S. Branicky_, Jan 20 2021
